content.raw: Even using _event->accept() was working, so I updated accordingly.

content.raw:
We usually don't leave the parameter name empty, if it won't be used, we comment it out. I think it's a style thing. Like this:

`void JointInspector::closeEvent(QCloseEvent */*_event*/)`
content.html:
We usually don't leave the parameter name empty, if it won't be used, we comment it out. I think it's a style thing. Like this:

void JointInspector::closeEvent(QCloseEvent */*_event*/)

content.raw:
Do I change the this keyword to _event ? 
I have made changes as per the rest of your comments.
content.html: Do I change the this keyword to _event ? I have made changes as per the rest of your comments.

content.raw: Please add a space before `*` and the variable name `_event`, like this: `QCloseEvent *_event`
content.html: Please add a space before * and the variable name _event, like this: QCloseEvent *_event

content.raw: Move this function definition to above the `dataPtr` definition. Also add doxygen documention (see similar comment below).
content.html: Move this function definition to above the dataPtr definition. Also add doxygen documention (see similar comment below).

Can you replace the line of the forward slashes with doxygen? Like:

/// \brief Qt close event
/// \param[in] _event Qt close event pointer

and add _event after the * in the function definition.
